title: Average but we enjoyed the regency club
text:
My wife and I stayed here for a week in March, 2020.

Pros:

(1). Well located and within walking distance of many sights or mass transit.

(2). Good Regency club with a nice view, breakfast and evening appetizers.

(3). Service at the Regency Club was very good, especially chef Nana.

(4). Housekeeping was excellent. They changed sheets daily without our asking.

Con:

(1). The suite is not a true suite; it is simply a larger room with a better bathroom. The view was nice but the balcony was unusable as it was so noisy.

(2). Bell service was not good. We arrived at 9pm and no one offered to help us with our bags when we got out f the private transport from the airport.

(3). I understand the need to be socially conscious but the large bottles of soap, shampoo and conditioner in the bathroom were difficult to use.

I am glad that the price dropped on my reservation as it was not worth $265USD per night.

title: My wife loved it!
text: Wife and I came here and she loved the local vendors and their products. She bought an expensive leather bag, jewelry and other things while I sat and waited. This is not my cup of tea but the wife loved it so it must be pretty good.

title: Beautiful building
text: I was very impressed with the building and it’s remodel into a shopping venue. The building is beautiful, well preserved and impressive. The vendors and shops were primarily on the higher end so it was okay to look but not buy. Come to look but save your cash for other shops.

title: Good but not great
text: Wife and I stopped here for lunch since it’s so close to our hotel. I ordered the souvlaki and she ordered the moussaka. The lamb souvlaki was very tasty but cooked well done which I hate. It was not tender and it was difficult to cut or chew. My wife’s moussaka was very good. There was a large party next to us that was very noisy and made the dining atmosphere less than ideal

title: Small but a It of high quality vendors
text: We go to farmers markets wherever we are. We found the Carriageworks to be on the smaller side but the quality of the vendors and products were top notch. We bought figs, crumpets, meat pie and several baked goods. Everything was excellent. My only complaint is that there should be a designated covered area to sit and eat your food. The areas provided were much too small.

title: Excellent food
text: Stopped here for lunch and were absolutely giddy at the quality of the food. My wife ordered the mussels (she loves them) in a marinara sauce. They were huge, plump and numerous. She was so happy. I ordered the lunch special of fish and chips for $18AUD and what the best fish and chips I have ever eaten. The cod was huge but perfectly done and moist, delicate and delicious. We were so happy that we will probably lay come back again for another meal before we leave Sydney.

title: Good ramen but not fantastic
text: Wife and I had a late lunch here to evade the crowd. I had the shoyu ramen (which they are know for) and my wife had the miso ramen. The shoyu ramen had a lot of flavor -- a lot of fish flavor with a layer of pork, but not salty. The miso ramen had a strong miso flavor but not overly so and not salty. Both were very good but not as good as Tsujita which sadly is no longer at Yokocho.

title: Great value at lunch for kamaaina
text: For kamaaina, it is 50% off their lunch special. The lunch special is a choice of soup or salad, and a choice of pasta (approximately 6 choices) or pizza (again, approximately 6 choices). My wife chose the squid ink pasta and I chose the tobiko pasta with calamari. Both were excellent and probably the best squid ink pasta we have ever had. They used a lot of squid ink in the pasta but it was not salty; just a tremendous amount of flavor. My tobiko pasta with calamari was also good but not as good as the squid ink pasta. Also got a comped dessert (tiramisu) because we were celebrating my birthday and that was also very tasty. All in all, a great value for an excellent lunch.

title: Great Happy Hour!
text: Our first night in Waikiki we had a happy hour at Basalt. Had the moscow mule ($6), hamburger ($6) and french fries ($2). All were excellent and a great value. Our only complaint was that previously we were able to sit outside but now happy hour is limited to seating at the bar. Regardless, a great value at happy hour.

title: Best Udon in Honolulu
text: My wife and I had lunch here and thought it was the best udon we have had in Honolulu. Beats Marukame Udon, Jimbo or Sekiya. I had the sukiyaki udon and my wife had the nabeyaki udon with the fat udon noodles (you are given a choice of skinny or fat noodles). Both were excellent and so filling. My bowl was massive but I was able to finish the noodles. We are definitely coming back and we're planning to try the udon happy hour next time!

title: Good location; nice property
text:
Wife and I stayed here for 2 nights. The hotel was previously an office tower renovated into a hotel. They did a good job on the renovation. As a globalist, I was upgraded to a suite which was really a large room with 2 queen beds and a sofa bed. The room was spacious and roomy. The bathroom was well done -- a wet room with shower and tub, and a Toto (Japanese) toilet washlet. My only complaint was that the lighting was poor in the bathroom. Bedding was comfortable and the room was quiet. Housekeeping did a good job daily.

Breakfast was limited; there is a small buffet ($24) and no ala carte menu.

Service was exceptional. Our check in with Tiare was the best we have had at a Hyatt property and that includes Grand Hyatt and Park Hyatt. Tiare went out of her way to show us 2 different rooms for our selection. I wish all employees were as customer oriented as she was.

For our purposes, Hyatt Centric is the perfect hotel. It is so well located that it is just a short walk to many fine restaurants and shopping. We are making this our "go to" hotel in Waikiki.

title: Good for a quick meal
text: Bute was a short 1 minute walk from the Park Hyatt, where we were staying. Excellent food and reasonable prices. I had a steak and wife had risotto. Both were very tasty.

title: Fantastic stay!
text:
My wife and I stayed at Park Hyatt Mendoza for 8 nights and had a great time. The hotel is beautiful and well located across the street from Independence Plaza. It is in walking distance of the best areas of Mendoza.

We had a corner suite which was very spacious. The living area of the suite had 2 sofas, side chair, a dining table with seating for 6, a desk, and a toilet and bidet. The bedroom had a king bed, lounge chair and ottoman. The bathroom had a toilet, bidet, shower and the closet. The closet was small -- they should have designed a walk in closet and taken space from the living area. Housekeeping was excellent and the suite was kept in great condition. My only complaint is that they should have a USB port on or near the nightstands in the bedroom.

We had free breakfast every morning as a globalist member. Breakfast was tasty and there was a good selection of hot dishes, cold dishes and baked goods on the buffet.

My only complaint for the hotel was check in as it took me a long time to check in. There should be a separate area for check in by elite members. There was no line management -- there should have been a line set up or hotel personnel directing the line to check in.

Shout out to Lucas Gimenez, manager of the hotel -- he went the extra mile to make our stay great. He took the time to introduce himself to us at check in and welcome us to the hotel. He later granted us an extended check out time so that we could stay in our suite until we had to leave for the airport (our flight was schedule to leave at 2AM). Greatly appreciated.

title: Wonderful dinner at a great price
text: We were staying at the Park Hyatt and looking for somewhere close by for dinner. This restaurant is 1 block from the hotel and we got there at opening (7PM) and got a table in the open courtyard. We started with a carpaccio appetizer which was simple but delicious. I had the spaghetti with seafood which was different from other seafood spaghetti that I have had. This dish had 3 mussels and 1 large shrimp -- not much seafood -- but the seafood taste was all in the sauce, which was fantastic. My wife had a trio of pasta and each was equally great. With a bottle of wine, our total bill was less than $50! A great meal at a great price. This was probably our best meal in Mendoza.

title: Great value
text: My wife and I came here for a 1 hour massage. The spa is located in an office building on the 3rd floor. The space is small but adequate. The treatment rooms were clean but sparse. The therapist was very professional and I really enjoyed my hour long massage. It was only 600 pesos ($10 USD) for the hour long massage so it was definitely a great value. We would definitely come back the next time we are in Mendoza.

title: Great home cooking
text: A food tour guide in Buenos Aires recommended this place and we were happy she did. Plenty of food served home style at a very reasonable price. Service was good even though we do not speak Spanish. Very comfortable and homey atmosphere.

title: Disappointing Market
text: We have been to many markets in Italy, Spain, France and Portugal. Compared to those markets and even the central market in Buenos Aires, this market was small and disappointing. It took no more than 30 minutes to walk the market and see the various vendors. We did not buy anything although we wanted to support the local vendors.

title: Wonderful time at a great hotel
text:
My wife and I spent 9 nights at Park Hyatt Buenos Aires to celebrate our wedding anniversary and had a wonderful time. The hotel is very well maintained and beautiful. It is located in Recoleta and perfectly fits the neighborhood. The hotel is within easy walking distance of many fine restaurants and bars. Our corner suite was spacious and very comfortable. Housekeeping did an excellent job daily. As we were celebrating our wedding anniversary, the manager provided complimentary sparkling wine and chocolate dipped strawberries— very nice touch.

Service was efficient. Joel, who manned the doors at the Posadas entrance to the hotel, was exceptional. Joel noticed that we were upset because our tour company failed to pick us up for our dinner and tango show for the 2nd time. Joel took the initiative to determine the problem and then got the concierge involved, who contacted the tango show and got the tour company to pick us up. Very impressed with Joel and the concierge; they are exceptional employees.

As a globalist we had free breakfast and we ate in both the Gioia restaurant and Piano Nobile. Breakfast on the terrace of Piano Nobile overlooking the gardens will be something we will never forget. Food quality was excellent. In fact, even room service was excellent; had the best cheeseburger ever from room service.

All in all, Park Hyatt Buenos Aires lived up to their stellar reputation.
place: Palacio Duhau - Park Hyatt Buenos Aires

title: The tour and Antonella were wonderful
text: My wife and I had a wonderful time on the Palermo tour with Antonella. We visited 3 restaurants— first for choripan, next for empanadas and then for steak, and at each establishment, the wine flowed freely. We were joined on the tour by 3 gentlemen, and they were excellent company and conversation was easy and comfortable. In addition, German, another tour guide, joined our group because his customers did not show up for their tour. So we had 2 guides for our tour. Antonella was very personable, knowledgeable, engaging and a wonderful guide for the afternoon. My wife and I do a food tour in every international city we visit, and this is one of the best tours we have been on. What we liked about this tour besides Antonella, was the selection of restaurants. They selected neighborhood restaurants with great food that we would not have otherwise found on our own. Well done!

title: Great neighborhood restaurant
text: My wife and I had lunch here with a local Argentine who recommended the restaurant I had the New York strip steak which was tender, tasty and a perfect medium rare. My wife had the grilled sweetbreads which were the best we have ever had. The restaurant had a number of locals having lunch so you know it is a good place. Service was excellent. Highly recommend this restaurant. Wish we could go back for another meal but we leave Buenos Aires tomorrow.

title: The highlight of our trip to Argentina
text: We booked an all day tour and couldn’t be happier with the entire experience. We flew on the first flight from Buenos Aires and were met at the airport by our guide, Eduardo. He gave us an overview of the national park and laid out the plans for the day. We first went to Devil’s Throat, then took the lower trail, and finally the upper trail in the park. It was a beautiful sunny day in the park but not close to being as impressive as the various waterfalls. After a long day of hiking, Eduardo took us to a nice buffet lunch for food, relaxation and recuperation. After lunch Eduardo took us back to the airport for our return flight to bueno Aires. We learned a lot and enjoyed ourselves immensely. Eduardo was a fantastic guide — engaging, thoughtful, friendly, knowledgeable and personable. Everything went according to plan and Eduardo made this a special day for my wife and I.
place: Private Full-Day Tour to Iguazu Falls National Park

title: Excellent food and reasonable prices
text: Wife and I had lunch here after walking the Puerto Madero area. Although we did not make reservations, we were quickly seated in a booth with a nice view of the water. We split a langostino crudo with a citrus sauce and a touch of limoncello — interesting and woke our tastebuds for our entrees. My wife ordered the seafood lasagna with squid ink. It was ver good although a little light on seafood. I ordered the spaghetti del mare which had a lot of seafood and linguine. The tomato sauce was light and sweet — probably San Marzano tomatoes. So 2 entrees, 1 appetizer and a bottle of Malbec for $43 — that’s a good deal. Service was efficient and excellent.

title: New area of the city along the water
text: Walked the area for about 3 hours. Reminded me of the China Basin area in San Francisco. Lots of restaurants and bars, offices and new condominium projects. We had lunch at La Parolaccia del mare along the water and had a great meal.

title: Beautiful architecture
text: A beautiful and well restored theatre that has been repurposed as a bookstore. Lots of customers and tourists inside. I applaud the architect for doing a great job.

title: Nice day, nice garden
text: Spent an hour visiting the Japanese Garden and it was an hour well spent. Well maintained and beautiful. Although not comparable to the gardens in Japan, the gardens were a welcome change from the usuL green spaces in Buenos Aires.

title: Wonderful afternoon!
text: My wife and I had a wonderful time on our Parilla tour in Palermo. Antonella was a great guide — personable, engaging, energetic, knowledgeable and entertaining. Conversation flowed freely along with the wine as we had a good group of easy going and fun people. What we liked most about the tour was the selection of Parilla — all were small neighborhood establishments with excellent food that locals frequent and we would not have found on our own. All had fantastic food and we especially loved the skirt steak at our last stop. My wife and I do a food tour in each international city we visit and this was one of the best.

title: Just what we needed
text: We stayed at Hyatt Place for a long layover. Shuttle was timely. We called the desk and although the driver was on a route to the airport, they called the driver to pick us up at the airport. We checked in and had a very satisfying sleep before returning to the airport 10 hours later for our flight to Buenos Aires. All in all, a good hotel for a short stay.

title: Good lounge; better emplo
text: We had. Long layover at IAH. we got to the Centurion lounge and sat in the dining area due to lack of seats. We had 2 servings of chicken and beans with rice which were much better than we got on the plane to Buenos Aires. Must compliment Jeremy for being an awesome employee. He was always busy bussing tables and helping customers and extremely pleasant. Actually Jeremy was the best thing in our lounge experience and we hope to see him t he next time we fly through IAH in 2 weeks.

title: Excellent cocktails; dinner not so much
text:
Came here with 2 other couples to celebrate my buddy’s 65th birthday. We had cocktails at the bar and although pricey, they were well balanced and excellent.

Wife and I shared the 22 ounce bone in rib eye ($96). Side dishes were terribly expensive! Baked potato or mashed potatoes were $15 each! Steak was done medium when we asked for medium rare. Pretty poor for a steakhouse that prides itself on steaks.

We will be back for cocktails but never for dinner again
place: Bavette's Steakhouse & Bar - Park MGM Las Vegas

title: Great noodles
text:
We came here twice for lunch because it was so delicious we couldn’t help ourselves. Hand pulled noodles in their spicy broth with super tender beef was one hands down favorite. We also had their dumplings but thought they weren’t as good as their hand pulled noodles.

Restaurant is small, clean and bright. Service was good and efficient. Prices are reasonable. Go early because it can get very crowded and you’ll have a wait in the heat.

title: Good value during happy hour
text: Came here with my wife, son and daughter on July 4th for hPpy hour drinks and appetizers. They have a great happy hour menu where ever dish is only $5! We had the chicken karaage, Kia geso, truffle tempura, salmon carpaccio, baked mussels and Cajun albacore sashimi. Everything was delicious. Only negative was that our server dropped a dish of food on the table and it soaked my son’s trousers. She made up for it by comping the dish and 2 rounds of drinks. All in all a good night.

title: What a deal!
text: Came here for happy hour and had the rib eye at 50% off. Great deal for quality steak. Rib eye steak was cooked perfectly and absolutely delicious. Cocktail was on point. Dark, old school steak house atmosphere. Excellent service and highly recommended.
place: Cleaver- Butchered Meats, Seafood & Classic Cocktails

title: Excellent sushi; Better than Excellent Price
text: Visited after a friend recommended this place to me. My wife and I, son and daughter came for lunch and had a feast. We had so many dishes I lost count of what we ordered. As mentioned by others, the fish to rice ratio on the nigiri sushi is great -- small rice portion and large fish portion -- which allows you to eat more sushi. The hamachi and salmon were the best of the day -- creamy, buttery and fresh. I don't know how they make any money but I hope they do! We'll be coming back every time we visit Las Vegas.

title: Hawaiian's direct flight from HNL to JFK is good
text: The direct flight from Honolulu to JFK New York is good. They provide several complimentary meals in economy and were very timely with drinks. They even served free alcohol in economy with your meal. Flight attendants were friendly and efficient. My only complaint is the room when the person in front of you reclines their seat. In that position its difficult to get out of your seat to use the restroom.

title: Great Location but Housekeeping was Terrible
text:
Stayed here for 9 nights.

PRO:

(1) Location was great. It is a 2 block walk to the subway station. There are numerous restaurants and bars within a 2 block radius for cheap and good Asian food.

(2) Pricing was reasonable when compared to other New York hotels.

(3) Free shuttle to/from LGA airport.

(4) Hotel manager was excellent in that he took personal responsibility for poor housekeeping and was very apologetic and pro-active.

CON:

(1) Housekeeping is evidently outsourced to an independent company. We were here for 9 nights and for 7 of those nights, housekeeping did something wrong. Don't they use a checklist to make sure everything has been done? One night its missing towels; 2 nights its missing toiletries; another night failed to change out the glasses and coffee mugs; 2 nights failed to clean the room.

(2) Breakfast was standard Hyatt Place fare but they over cooked the scrambled eggs every morning.

However, good value for the money.

title: Good hotel but not up to Grand Hyatt standards
text:
We stayed here for 10 nights in March. As a Globalist, I used an upgrade certificate to get a suite. The suite was spacious and well designed. There was a bathroom off of the entry way in addition to the main bathroom adjacent to the bedroom. A couch, comfortable chair, coffee table, end table, and circular dining table were in the main living area of the suite. The bathroom was large with a large walk in shower. Wine infused toiletries were very nice. As the hotel was recently renovated, everything appeared new and clean. Towels were exceptional -- fluffy, large and clean. It was very disappointing that although they had a coffee machine in the room, there was a charge per pod for coffee. Even low level Holiday Inn properties provide free coffee in-room.

Breakfast was provided every morning in the top floor restaurant. The buffet was generous but the selections never changed. We were here for 10 nights and it got very boring. One waitress, Maria, was exceptional. She was very attentive, friendly and always smiling. An exceptional employee.

We went looking for the Regency Club and found that it was a portion of the lobby bar. They separated a portion of the lobby bar for Globalists and others who have club access. Very disappointing when compared to Regency Clubs in other Grand Hyatts. The lobby area can be very noisy and not very conducive to having a peaceful drink in the evening. It would be better if they used a portion of the 10th floor restaurant (where they serve breakfast in the morning) as it would be quieter and provide a nice view. The appetizers that were served (cold cuts, nuts, cheese) were under whelming.

As noted in other reviews, the hotel is not located in the best area. It is a minimum 15 minute walk to the metro through a very sketchy area with many sex clubs. Wife and I walked one morning but she refused to walk the area thereafter. At least central Athens is a short cab ride away.

Service was spotty. Check in was very good; fast, friendly and efficient. Everything I wanted after travelling almost 24 hours to get to Athens. Room service menu was limited (there were no Greek entrees) and very expensive. Wife and I were too tired to go out for dinner the first night after 24 hours of travel so we ordered 2 pasta dishes from room service. The pasta was bland, without taste and cost us 42 Euros! Terrible and never again.

title: Best pinxtos!
text: Wife and I visyhere on a pinxto tour. We had the foie gras pinxto and baby squid with balsamic vinegar pixtos. Both were to die for. Absolutely the best pinxto we had during our 7 night stay in San Sebastian. Do t miss this place!

title: If you like mussels, this is the place to go
text: Wife and I had 2 Mussels pinxto and afried baby squid. Wonderful! Lot of meaty mussels in each dish; one garlic dish and the other in a slightly sweet tomato sauce. The baby squid was perfect; lighlt battered and fried so the freshness was still highlighted. Mayonnaise and a slight hot sauce was added that made it so tasty. Place gets crowded so best to go when they open.

title: Excellent
text: Had Pintxo de Txuleta, Txuleta croquette and tortilla. They also served a complimentary tapa paella. All were excellent. Great value for the price and very generous pour of txakoli. Highly recommend this place.

title: The BEST!
text: wife and I had lunch here and tried the tripe appetizer and oxtails entree. Both were the best we have ever had (and we have had a lot of both). It’s tough to get a table without a reservation but we came 15 minutes before they opened and we’re able to score a table. We also had Pintxos on 2 separate days here and they were all excellent. Pintxo bar area can get very crowded so if you don’t like fighting the crowd, get here early.

title: Quality airport hotel
text: Stayed here overnight before an early morning flight. Airport shuttle is excellent— on time, clean, helpful. Hotel room was better than we expected and definitely better than US holiday inns. Room was clean, modern and fresh. Would stay here again.
place: Holiday Inn Athens Attica Avenue Airport West

title: Good food and value
text: Wife nd I had our first meal in San Sebastián at this restaurant. It was a good introduction to basque food. We had the grilled octopus and grilled rib eye steak. Both were delicious although I thought the steak could have been better salted/seasoned. Busy atmosphere but the service was excellent.

title: We loved the tour!
text: Our guide, Kris, gave my wife and I a wonderful 3 hour Pintxos tour in the old city. We visited 3 places and had wine and 2 types of Pintxos at each stop. She ordered the best Pintxos at each stop, many of which were not on the bar and only ones that a local would know. Kris is very personable, friendly, enthusiastic and entertaining. I’m glad we took the tour early in our stay so that we can revisit the bars or explore other bars recommended by Kris.

title: Great hamburger
text: Visited the restaurant and used our priority pass for $56 credit against lunch bill. My wife and I had the hamburger and we thought it was one of the best burgers we have had. Juicy, nice and soft brioche bun and quality meat. Service was quick and on point. We will definitely be going back.

title: Good value and great shuttle service
text: We flew into SFO on a red eye flight and spent 6 hours at the hotel before catching our flight to Europe. Shuttle service was excellent — timely, friendly and efficient. Hotel room was perfect for a shower and nap before catching our flight. The Regency Club breakfast had a decent selection. Happy with the vale proposition and quality of service.

title: Excellent tour
text: We did a day tour to Delphi with Key Tour. We were very happy with the tour and the value of the tour. Our tour guide, Kostas, was excellent. He was very knowledgeable as he studied archeology at the University of Athens. They gave sufficient time at each of the stops so we did not feel rushed. My only complaint is that they did not notify me what time they would pick us up at our hotel. The tour started at 8:30 and I expected to be picked up at around that time. We were very surprised when the driver arrived at 7:40 to pick us up. We hurriedly dressed and ran downstairs. They should have emailed us a pickup time.
place: Delphi: A Day Tour at the Navel of the World from Athens

title: Excellent lunch
text:
Had
Unch on a rainy day so the restaurant was not crowded. Had the dolmade, gyro and sea bream. Every dish was presented well and delicious. The sea bream was the highlight of the lunch. 40 euros for the lunch in las half liter of house wine. Very happy!

title: Simply perfect
text: Used welcome pickups for airport transfer from Athens airport to the grand Hyatt. Driver was waiting for us outside of the baggage area with a name board. Giannis was friendly and very customer oriented. His car was clean and smoke free. Highly recommended.

title: Nice area to dis over
text: Wife and I walked Plaka for several hours after visiting the Acropolis. A lot of great stores, restaurants, coffee houses and bars. Very relaxing and interesting walk through Plaka.

title: It is awesome!
text: Unbelievably beautiful and awe inspiring. Best to go early to beat the tour groups and cruise ship tours. We went when they opened at 8am and enjoyed the quiet of this great mountain and it’s majestic ruins. Simply the best!

title: Beautiful museum
text: Went here the day before visiting the a acropolis. The museum is modern, well laid out and easy to get to. It can get crowded so best to go early.

title: So good that we went there 3 days in a row!
text: It is a neighborhood Taverna with great food and prices. Service is friendly and prompt. The restaurant was recommended to us by our tour guide and it was fabulous. We were looking for local Greek food and this place hit it out of the park! Best dish was their Moussaka — simply devine. We also had grilled sardines, grilled sausage, grilled octopus, souvlaki,Greek salad, and mussels. Every dish was well done.

title: Good tour and great guide
text: We took a day tour to the ruins of Delphi and were very pleased. The guide, Kostas, was very personable and informative;he was great. The bus was comfortable and clean. They gave us sufficient time at each stop to see the sites. It was very good value for the day long trip. My only complaint is that they did not inform me of the pickup time from my hotel. The tour started at 8:30am and I assumed they would pick us up sometime after that. They arrived at our hotel at 7:40 to pick us up and tKe us to the main office. Obviously we were very surprised and had to rush to get dressed and ready. Not a good way to start. Long day.

title: Good Malay food
text: The restaurant is in the Suria KLCC shopping mall which is near the Grand Hyatt Kuala Lumpur where we were staying. We went to Madam Kwan's on a Monday for lunch and it was very busy with office workers and tourists which made for a very noisy atmosphere. Contrary to other reviews, service was efficient and prompt even though they were busy. We had the mixed Malaysian Satay and Hokkien fried noodles. The Satay was tender and tasty with the peanut sauce. The Hokkien fried noodles had an excellent depth of flavor without being salty. Prices were reasonable for being in a high end mall.

title: WOW! Best Hyatt experience we have ever had
text:
We returned home yesterday from our 9-night stay at Grand Hyatt Kuala Lumpur and still are in awe of the GHKL, the food, the premises and most of all, its staff. We have stayed at many Hyatt properties in the world – GH Hong Kong, GH Singapore, GH Macau, GH Bangkok, GH Seoul, GH Fukuoka, Andaz Tokyo, Park Hyatt Vienna, Park Hyatt Saigon, HR Kyoto, etc. – and we can enthusiastically say that the GHKL is the best Hyatt property we have visited.

Our first impression as we entered the property was the bell persons opening the door, quickly retrieving our bags from the taxi and guiding us to the 39th floor lobby. There, we were struck by the awesome night views of the Petronas Towers from the check in area. We were efficiently checked in, then led to our suite by the assistant manager on duty. We were upgraded to a suite and when we opened the door to the suite we were awestruck by the size, layout, styling, floor to ceiling windows and views from the suite. The bathroom layout with its extra large, 2-person, circular soaking tub was spectacular. They also provided us with complimentary fresh fruit, cookies and nuts – very nice touch after a long day of travelling.

We visited the Grand Club Lounge the 2nd night of our stay and went there every night thereafter because the food, service and views were exceptional. Our compliments to chef Rolf (who we were lucky to meet) as the food was varied, excellent in taste and presentation. The food was by far the best we have ever had in a Grand Club Lounge in the world! We especially loved the sea bass which we have never had in any other Hyatt property. We enjoyed breakfast every morning at THIRTY8 where the food was equally excellent but with a larger selection. We really loved the nasi lamak, dim sum and chinese noodles offered at the breakfast buffet. We were greeted every evening by the fantastic club lounge staff. They are all friendly, customer oriented and they made my wife and I feel very much welcomed, comfortable and at ease. Kudos to Kathryna, Peggy, Hameeth, Lysia, Ash, Jing Yi, Belle and Li Yean for their excellent service!

Unfortunately, our 9-night stay came to an end but not without the club lounge staff thoughtfully giving us a going away gift. We had some of the wonderful pineapple pastries with our tea this morning at home but it made us sad that we weren't sitting in our suite at GHKL. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary and it was memorable because of GHKL and the staff at GHKL.

title: Very busy but good food
text: We waited an hour to get seated on a busy Saturday. We have been to other branches of Din Tai Fung in Hong Kong, Macau and Singapore but wanted to try them in their home country. Food was consistent with our past visits. The Xiao Long Bao was very tasty. The drunken chicken was the best we have had at any restaurant. We also tried their beef noodle soup which was tasty but not as good as what we had at Yong Kang Beef Noodle several days later. Overall, very good food but I won’t wait an hour next time.

title: Wonderful stay!
text: As a globalist, we were upgraded to a suite which made our stay very luxurious and comfortable. The hotel is well located next to Taipei 101 mall and the subway stop. It made getting around the city very easy. Service was impeccable from the check in to check out. Food at the Grand Club was excellent and rotated well during our 9 night stay. If we come back to Taipei, we will be coming back to the Grand Hyatt.

title: Xiao long boa and hand pulled noodles were great
text: The xiao long bao here is better than Din Tai Fung as the soup is tastier and the wrapper thinner than at Din Tai Fung. We also had the hand pulled noodles in their signature pork bone soup with grilled pork belly, which was at the same time rich yet light and full of flavor. The noodle texture was al dente. We were extremely happy with the food and we didn’t have to wait an hour to get seated like at Din Tai Fung.
